5. Emergency Response Program

The plant maintains a written emergency response plan, which provides essential planning and training for protecting workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.  

The Industrial Park owner, The Dow Chemical Company Seadrift Site, leads the execution of all emergency response activities.  The plant's written emergency plan is integrated with Dow's plan, and all external communications are coordinated in accordance with our written plan; Dow manages alerts to the community through the Care hotline.
Detailed Seadrift Site emergency response plans are developed and coordinated with the local emergency planning committee  and the community.  A Mutual Aid Network has been established with the local emergency planning committee and other local chemical plants to further enhance the ability to respond to an emergency.    
The facility updates its emergency response program, as appropriate, in response to modifications to facility processes or regulatory requirements.


6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Braskem believes in the philosophy of continuous improvement.  Programs are in place to monitor the status of ongoing efforts and identify opportunities to improve.  The Seadrift plant maintains a structured safety process, as well as employee safety teams that meet regularly.

The Plant has not identified any changes to safety practices necessary to achieve or maintain compliance with any applicable regulatory standard since our last submission.  However, as part of our efforts to continually improve safety at the plant, several projects are currently in-progress to further enhance safety including the following: Pressure Safety Valves (PSVs) documentation Project, Piping labeling in the field Project, and Modicon Software & CPU Upgrade Project.

Braskem actively encourages participation by all its employees in process safety management and provides relevant process safety information and procedures to all employees. Employees participate in PHA revalidation studies and PHA studies triggered through our Management of Change Program.  We engage experienced employees to develop and administer our training programs.  Our employees and contractors are well trained, and they actively participate in the investigation of any incidents or accidents.  We also encourage employee suggestions for process safety improvement, and we regularly implement enhancements based on these suggestions.
Our Mechanical Integrity Program includes written procedures governing the inspection and maintenance of affected process equipment. As prescribed by our Management of Change Procedure, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews are designed to ensure safe process operations following any new installations or modifications. The Plant has also developed and implemented a Hot Work Permit Procedure to prevent performance of hot work in potentially dangerous areas.
Through implementation of these multiple elements of our prevention program, the Plant minimizes accidental chemical releases. To enhance and reinforce the Plant and employee commitment to the standard underlying these management systems, the Company has established both specific accountability and controls for implementation of these systems in support of the Plant's high standards for accident prevention.

1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Braskem America's Seadrift Operations is committed to operating and maintaining our polypropylene manufacturing process in a safe and responsible manner. We have developed and implemented programs to ensure the safety of our employees, the public, and the environment, including those that satisfy Braskem's corporate standards and applicable government requirements.  Braskem's programs satisfy or exceed all applicable requirements under both the   Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Risk Management Program (RMP).  To ensure that our programs remain fully compliant, we periodically re-validate our Process Hazard Analyses (PHAs) for covered processes to ensure that process hazards remain properly identified, understood, and adequately mitigated. We also utilize these PHA revalidations to identify opportunities for further safety enhancements as needed.  Braskem also conducts periodic compliance audits to ensure maintenance of administrative policies and mitigation controls to help prevent accidents and releases. The facility manager retains primary responsibility for safe operation of the facility.  In addition, all employees participate in safety related teams, projects, audits, and other activities and are trained to adhere to established policies and procedures

2. Description of Facility and Regulated Substances Handled

The Braskem Seadrift facility includes operations to produce polypropylene using a variety of chemicals including RMP regulated substances.
